whatIs.title: What is One Rep Max (1RM)?
whatIs.description: One Rep Max (1RM) is the maximum amount of weight that can be lifted for a single repetition for a given exercise. It's a crucial metric for strength training and programming, helping athletes and fitness enthusiasts track their progress and set appropriate training loads.

calculators.title: How Our Calculators Work
calculators.description: We use five different scientifically-validated formulas to estimate your 1RM:

epley.name: Epley Formula
epley.description: Most commonly used, provides reliable estimates across different rep ranges.

mcglothin.name: McGlothin Formula
mcglothin.description: Offers a different approach that some find more accurate for their lifting style.

lombardi.name: Lombardi Formula
lombardi.description: Uses an exponential calculation that some powerlifters prefer.

oconner.name: O'Conner Formula
oconner.description: A simpler calculation that still provides reliable estimates.

tips.warmup: Always warm up properly before attempting heavy lifts
tips.spotter: Have a spotter when attempting near-maximal lifts
tips.listen: Listen to your body and rest when needed

results.title: Using the Results
results.description: The calculated 1RM is an estimate and should be used as a guide. When programming your training, use these numbers to calculate appropriate working weights for different rep ranges and intensities.
